Docs.summary: Represents the pager row in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewPagerRow> is created to hold the pager controls in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.INamingContainer> interface is a marker that indicates that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewPagerRow> control is part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object's control hierarchy.
This class is used primarily by control developers. Control developers can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewPagerRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.CreateRow%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.InitializePager%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> class to create a custom pager row.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewPagerRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor calls the base class constructor, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.%23ctor%2A>, with the specified parameters. For a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewPagerRow> control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control, the call is made `rowType` equal to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Pager> and `rowState` equal to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState.Normal>.
